timeline.message: uber jar with only Iceberg dependencies in it

timeline.bodyText: More probably need to be added but the below appears to be the bare minimum needed in order to execute the table DDL and perform a simple query of a Parquet Iceberg table from Hive.
timeline.author: massdosage

timeline.bodyText:
why not add dependencies using the compile configuration. ? Adding it this way, I think only adds that specific dependency and not their transitive artifacts. Also I'm not sure just using a group id is a good idea here as it may include unnecessary jars.
Maybe we can do something similar to what other runtime modules are doing
timeline.author: rdsr

replies.bodyText: Yeah, as I said in the comment, I've just done this to see what the bare minimum needed to get it working on a cluster is. Once we have it actually working properly in Hive I can fix this up. I can try not specifying any dependencies and inherit all the compile time ones and relocate the problematic ones but my concern is that we're going to then end up having a huge number of clashes with other jars on Hive's classpath which is why I wanted to narrow this down to as few as possible.
replies.author: massdosage

timeline.message: refactor uber jar out into a separate subproject

timeline.bodyText: I copied this and NOTICE from iceberg-spark-runtime do I need to modify them in any way? Can we use the files from the project root instead?
timeline.author: massdosage

replies.bodyText:
This is a good start, but we will need to modify them.
LICENSE and NOTICE content is specific to what is actually in the Jar, so we will need to remove the license information for any library that isn't in the Hive runtime and add any new ones that weren't in Spark. It just requires going through the Jar file and making sure all the libraries are accounted for.
replies.author: rdblue

replies.bodyText: If you want, we can get the module out with a follow-up item to go over the LICENSE and NOTICE files. I know that's a difficult task for anyone who hasn't done it before. I normally go through the runtime modules just before a release and update them.
replies.author: rdblue

replies.bodyText: I'll give this a go, shouldn't be too hard.
replies.author: massdosage

timeline.bodyText: This name matches the module its based on, another option would be hive-runtime.
timeline.author: massdosage

replies.bodyText: I think we should use iceberg-hive-runtime. Eventually, we will probably rename iceberg-mr to iceberg-hive. We also need to rename iceberg-hive to iceberg-hive-metastore.
replies.author: rdblue

replies.bodyText: Sure, I'll rename this now. As for the iceberg-hive-metastore rename, I'm happy to do that too, should that be in a separate PR or as part of this one?
replies.author: massdosage

replies.bodyText: That would be great, thank you! I think a separate PR.
replies.author: rdblue

replies.bodyText: Cool, I'll get that up in the next day or two. Thanks for merging this one.
replies.author: massdosage

replies.bodyText: No problem! I think with this one and filter pushdown in, we're about ready for a release with Hive read support! Would be good to get projection pushdown in, but I'm not sure how difficult that will be.
replies.author: rdblue

replies.bodyText: Agreed, @cmathiesen is looking into projection pushdown as well as some documentation for the basic Hive read support.
replies.author: massdosage

timeline.bodyText: I compared the contents of the uber jar and the LICENSE and NOTICE files from the spark-runtime project and it looks like hive-runtime contains a subset of  what is inspark-runtime so doesn't require anything additional. I removed everything from these two files that isn't actually in the jar file so this should now be correct.
timeline.author: massdosage
